The car brand is similar to:
the Hyundai Elantra, a compact sedan that's been on sale since 2008.

Hyundai's new Elantra is a sports sedan, and it's expected to be a bit smaller than the Elantra's 570-horsepower V-8. It's expected to be available in the US in late 2015.

Hyundai is also expected to release its new compact and sports sedan, the Kia Soul, in late 2015.

The new Elantra will be available in the US with a base price of $46,500 and will be offered with a 5-door, 6-passenger coupe or SUV, depending on the model, and a 7-door, 8-passenger sedan.

The Elantra will be powered by a 2.0-liter four-cylinder, producing 305 horsepower and 335 pound-feet of torque.

It will be available in both the US and the UK, and will come with a 7-speed manual transmission.
